1064951851584491520.text: 5)Cryptocurrency Volatility. The volatility does not help businesses and end consumers. Question from @work_blockchain > Is a stable coin really the answer?

1064951850519224322.text: 4)User Experience. It's apparent that there are hundreds or even thousands of Decentralised Applications being built with poor UI designs. Question from @work_blockchain > Why is the UI design not up to scratch?

1064951849437093889.text: 3)Uncertainty around Regulation.We agree that regulation in support of blockchain & DLT tech is needed, not in 5-15 yrs time but NOW! Question from @work_blockchain. How much impact does lack of regulation have for businesses & technologists developing blockchain based solutions?

1064951848359129088.text: Education > Lack of engineers and expertise. Question from @work_blockchain. Is this due to a limited number of expert knowledge in the the tech or is there more to it than this as to why there are only 4 universities who are teaching these topics fully?

1064951847256014848.text: 2)Education. @work_blockchain identified just 4 UK universities; @KingsCollegeLon @ucl @imperialcollege @EdinburghUni who are teaching cryptocurrency & blockchain tech while there are a growing number of universities in the US who are teaching these topics. The UK must do more!

1064951846043828225.text: 1)Scalability. This is common knowledge in the blockchain space. Many exciting projects at R&D stage who are working on this right now. This topic was not really discussed today during the panel.

1064951845049765888.text: CONCLUSION on the key challenges from @work_blockchain. Blockchain tech has a lot of potential. Based on our experience & having been in this space for 3 years+, we identified 5 key challenges for blockchain technology & cryptocurrency to reach mainstream adoption today.

1064951844001193985.text: CONCLUSION from @robertlearney. Focus on the data layer economics first and the value transfer later.

1064951841551773696.text: *we will not have one blockchain - it's not about the technology but more about the regulation in support of technology.

1064951840482213889.text:
*blacklist. Organisation who can blacklist an individual > organisation having too much power is not where we want to go
*what’s the alternative to ID authentication and likability. Alternative is to couple data minimisation & only use the required data. Data needs to be isolated

Notes on Geoffrey Goodell, Senior Research Associate @UCL:
* “trust v blind faith” - Trust but verify. It is essential to have verifiable trust
*it is possible that tokens may be useful in the future
*cartel in the payment networks space. Inter-mediation> do we really need Visa?

1064951838112448512.text: *trust but verify. @MariaTanjala believes that "you need an intersection of the two where you allow people to fetch and verify the data, and you need to incentivised people to input the correct data".
